poem:
Title: The Cost of Care

With £64.80 in heart and hand,
Helen wove a sorrowful thread.
The supermarket job on stand,
the lover slowly sinking to the bed.

Cancer, the beast in Mark's throat,
Sainsbury's shift one too many.
Fining the carer, a note duly wrote,
£6000, the cost too uncanny.

Wrapped in winter's cold embrace,
love's currency falls in a broken space.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Grater took unpaid leave from her low-paid job at Sainsbury’s and drew £64.80 a week in carer’s allowance so she could look after him full-time. The".
